IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: STRENGTHENING THE COMMUNITY THROUGH PHILANTHROPY BY ADDRESSING COMMUNITY PRIORITIES AND INTERESTS, MAKING RESPONSIVE AND INFORMED GRANTS, BEING PRUDENT AND ACCOUNTABLE MANAGERS OF FUNDS, AND STIMULATING AND FACILITATING INDIVIDUAL PHILANTHROPY.
IRS990.MissionDesc: STRENGTHENING THE COMMUNITY THROUGH PHILANTHROPY BY ADDRESSING COMMUNITY PRIORITIES AND INTERESTS, MAKING RESPONSIVE AND INFORMED GRANTS, BEING PRUDENT AND ACCOUNTABLE MANAGERS OF FUNDS, AND STIMULATING AND FACILITATING INDIVIDUAL PHILANTHROPY locally, regionally and nationally.
IRS990.Desc: OPRFCF provides a central resource for donors, professional financial advisors, student scholarships and non-profit organizations serving Oak Park and River Forest. For donors, we provide value and expertise in helping them explore and implement giving options. For non-profits serving our residents, we manage endowment funds and provide opportunities to apply for and receive grants. We also manage scholarship programs for several of our fundholders.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Success of All Youth (SAY) is a community collective impact effort addressing the social & emotional, academic, and health & safety needs of youth from cradle to career. One full time director and one part time communications manager facilitated and supported the work of the initiative. (includes direct salary/benefit and other operations costs)

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: The Foundation offered 10 Impact Excellence Seminars in 2015 which were attended by 229 participants from 60 local nonprofits. These seminars covered a range of topics including, Funding for Impact, Impact Measurement and Evaluation, Enhancing your Volunteer Program, How to Talk to your Donors about your Endowment and a Board Boot Camp. Furthermore (6) local nonprofits received technical assistance and consulting support in 2015/2016 to address key needs related to measuring the impact of their work. This technical assistance was provided to organizations working in different sectors; and across varying operational contexts including partnerships and mergers. Results of the technical assistance include the development of a clear framework of outcomes and indicators for all participating organizations; and demonstration of the value and impact of program activities which informs program design, marketing, communications and fundraising efforts. (does not include salary/benefit costs)

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: Future Philanthopist Program provides young people with opportunities to participate in a uniquely-adapted philanthropic experience. Area high school students apply for this two year program which turns juniors into grant makers and seniors into fundraisers. Program expenses cover the cost of meetings and other related costs.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE OAK PARK-RIVER FOREST COMMUNITY FOUNDATION SERVES AS A CORPORATE TRUSTEE AND ADMINISTERS GRANT DISTRIBUTIONS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE PROGRAM DIRECTOR MONITORS THE GRANT REPORTS WHICH ARE RECEIVED FROM THE GRANT RECIPIENTS DETAILING THE USE OF THE GRANTS. THESE GRANT REPORTS ARE MATCHED TO THE GRANT APPLICATION TO ENSURE THE PURPOSE OF THE GRANT IS BEING ACCOMPLISHED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE 990 IS REVIEWED BY THE AUDIT COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD, PRIOR TO SUBMISSION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ON AN ANNUAL BASIS, MEMBERS OF THE FOUNDATION'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS COMPLETE A STATEMENT REGARDING ANY POSSIBLE CONFLICTS OF INTEREST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
THE AUDIT COMMITTEE IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE SELECTION OF AUDITORS AND REVIEW OF THE AUDIT RESULTS. THIS PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED SINCE THE PRIOR YEAR.
